DYNAMIC AM CONTROL OF THE TRANSVERSE MODES OF A SELF-PULSING SEMICONDUCTOR LASER
column13: A semiconductor laser, at appropriate values of current above threshold, enters a nonlinear regime characterized by (1) a continuous region in which the output radiation self-pulses simultaneously in two competing transverse modes and/or (2) a bistable region in which the output radiation self-pulses in either of two noncompeting transverse modes, but not both. In one embodiment the laser is current biased in one of these regions and is switched between different transverse modes by amplitude modulating the injection current.

column13: A pill dispenser mechanism is provided in which a multilayered compartment is releasably attachable to a receptacle for pills in such a way that pills may be selectively advanced into one compartment, then by selective advancement of one of the compartment layers transfer the pill from the first compartment into a discharge compartment to permit sequential recovery of pills therefrom. In order to accommodate different sized pills, the compartments may be provided with different sized openings to conform to the substantial size and configuration of the pill. Electrical contact switches may be associated with the compartments to sense for the purpose of recording the movement of a pill between one or more, or a combination of both, compartments.

column12: Three-dimensional imaging by projecting morphologically filtered pixel data
column13: In three-dimensional imaging of ultrasound data, speckle artifact data are reduced before the acquired data from a volume of interest are projected onto an image plane. A master controller performs an algorithm that iteratively morphologically filters (28) the pixel data in a volume of interest and then iteratively projects (30,32,34) the morphologically filtered data onto a plurality of rotated image planes using a ray-casting technique. Morphological filtering is performed by stepping a seven-point kernel through a source data volume of pixel data. The kernel, made up of a central pixel value and the six pixel values adjacent to the central pixel value, is stepped through the entire source data volume. The morphological filtering operation includes at least one erosion step, which removes speckle, followed by an equal number of dilation steps, which restore the imaging data.

column12: Improved polystyrene
column13: Toughened styrene polymers are made by polymerizing styrene or an ar-methylstyrene, with or without comonomers, in the presence of 1 to 20%, based on the weight of the styrene polymer of an unsaturated copolymer rubber made by copolymerizing two or more alpha-olefins together with 0.5 to 15% of a compound containing at least two non-conjugated ethylenic linkages. Preferred alpha-olefins are ethylene and propylene. Comonomers specified for use with the styrene are alpha-methyl-styrene, chlorostyrenes, acrylonitrile and methyl methacrylate. The examples describe dissolving copolymer rubber in styrene monomer and polymerizing the resulting solutions in the presence of di-tertiary butyl peroxide.

column12: Dispenser especially adapted for dispensing medication units
column13: A dispenser for medication units such as pills, tablets, caplets, and capsules which allows dispensing of a single medication unit upon the simple push of a button or verbal request includes a control system which allows convenient changes, optionally responsive to instructions from a physician or other medical personnel via a modem over telephone lines, in the frequency and dosage of one medication in a regimen, without altering the schedule for other medications. The dispenser includes at least one elongated plastic band possessing at least one facing surface covered by a compressible material, such as elastomer foam, cloth, or brush bristles, having medication units sandwiched between the layers of the band or bands wound in abutting overlying relation on a storage reel. In order to dispense the medication units, rotating mechanisms unwind the band or bands from the storage reel onto separate take-up reel or reels, causing the dispensed medication units to fall and interrupt a light beam detector. Rotating mechanisms for the take-up reel or reels may comprise manual hand cranks, clock springs, or electric motors. A control system includes a CPU, memory, a timer, a modem, and an activation signal input device for regulating the amount, time, and frequency of administration, and for allowing changes in the medication regimen. A plurality of storage reels with associated take-up reels combined in a single dispenser allows dispensing of various different medications at different dosages and intervals depending upon the requirements of a particular medication regimen.

column12: Drive rivet
column13: A drive rivet fastens a plurality of panel members together as a unit. The drive rivet is installed within preformed holes which are drilled or punched through each of the panel members. The drive rivet includes a head portion which abuts the outer surface of the first panel member when installed. A shank portion extends from the head portion and includes a plurality of expansible prongs on its distal end which protrude out from the opposite end of the panel members. The shank portion includes at least a first area of substantially constant diameter and a second area of decreased diameter less than that of the first area which is not in contact with the panel members when the drive rivet is received therein. A generally elongated bore is formed within the drive rivet which is adapted for receiving an expander pin. The expander pin is driven through the elongated bore which urges the expansible prongs outward, which causes the shanks second area of decreased diameter into engagement with the panel members, in order for securing the panel members in the fastened position.

column12: IMPROVEMENTS IN OR RELATING TO METHODS AND APPARATUS FOR MODULATING A SEMICONDUCTOR LASER
column13: 1299847 Lasers WESTERN ELECTRIC CO Inc 25 Nov 1970 [1 Dec 1969] 56022/70 Heading H1C A semi-conductor laser is continuously pumped at a temperature chosen such that selfinduced pulses occur in its output, and the pumping energy is amplitude modulated to give pulse position modulation. The frequency and depth of modulation are chosen to avoid phase locking the laser output pulses to the modulating signal, the choice being made empirically, i.e. by measuring the modulation power required to phase lock the output and subsequently maintaining the power below this level. The selfinduced pulses occur in the microwave region with pumping energies of 1À1-3 times the laser threshold; temperature ranges of 77-110‹ K. are quoted for a GaAs injection diode laser. The pulses apparently occur because of dispersion in the semi-conductor and locking between longitudinal modes. The device is located in a microwave transmission line for coupling to a modulating source, so that the incident modulating microwaves alter the pumping current. The modulation power is around 1 mw. The variation of the output pulse position with the modulating signal may be adjusted by choice of the size of the diode heat sink. The modulating signal may also be used to vary the pumping energy of semi-conductor lasers which are pumped optionally or by an electron beam. Feedback may be applied to stabilize the pulse width, the feedback being electrical, optical or electro-optical as in Specification 1,266,086. Several lasers may be used in a multiplex communication system, and the lasers may have differing output frequencies as in Specification 1,266,084.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH LISTINGS GROUPS

column13: -38- A system and method for determining measurements of an image of an object appearing in a radiograph generated from a radiation source are provided. The system comprises a base platform, a size-calibrating object having one calibrated dimension and a positioning apparatus for the size-calibrating object. The positioning apparatus has a first part coupled to the base platform extending from the base platform and a second part associated with the first part to position the size calibrating object at a location about the object. The method utilizes radiographs and images of objects therein to calculate x-ray attenuation coefficients of objects.

column12: Methods and systems for wireless communication in a reflective environment
column13: A method for wireless communication in a reflective environment includes (a) receiving first wireless signals at a first antenna assembly at least partially via a first reflective environment, (b) generating a first electrical signal from a first antenna element of the first antenna assembly in response to the first wireless signals, the first antenna element having a first polarization, (c) generating a second electrical signal from a second antenna element of the first antenna assembly in response to the first wireless signals, the second antenna element having a second polarization different from the first polarization, (d) shifting phase of at least one of the first electrical signal and the second electrical signal, and (e) after shifting phase, combining at least the first electrical signal and the second electrical signal to generate a combined electrical signal.

column12: PILL DISPENSER
column13: A pill dispenser mechanism is provided in which a multilayered compartment is releasably attachable to a receptacle for pills in such a way that pills may be selectively advanced into one compartment, then by selective advancement of one of the compartment layers transfer the pill from the first compartment into a discharge compartment to permit sequential recovery of pills therefrom. In order to accommodate different sized pills, the compartments may be provided with different sized openings to conform to the substantial size and configuration of the pill. Electrical contact switches may be associated with the compartments to sense for the purpose of recording the movement of a pill between one or more, or a combination of both, compartments.

column12: PORTABLE MISTING SYSTEM
column13: A portable misting system includes a carrying case, a fluid pump arranged within the carrying case, and a power source arranged within the carrying case to provide electrical power to the fluid pump. A working fluid source provides a working fluid to the fluid pump via a supply line, a distribution line receives a pressurized working fluid from the fluid pump, and one or more spray nozzles are coupled to the distribution line to discharge the pressurized working fluid as a mist.

column12: EPILATORY COMPOSITIONS.
column13: An epilatory composition, substantially provided as flat strips, comprises a gel-like matrix material, for example a rosin-based or sugar-based material and, mixed with the matrix material, a particulate material, for example colloidal particles of fumed silica, and a polyethylene in the form of a homopolymer. The particles reduce the tendency of the epilatory composition to flow, under warm ambient conditions with improved efficacy over known epilatory compositions.

column12: Improvements in Centrifugal Separators.
column13: 26,045. Raasloff, H. de, and Brown, T. E. Nov. 13. Machines for separating liquids from solids by density; drums. - In a continuous-action centrifugal machine for separating solids from liquids, the supplying-means and the outlets from the separating-chamber are so arranged that a vacuous space exists in the chamber near the axis in order to prevent the escape of liquid from the outlet for the solids. In the construction shown in Fig. 1, a number of chambers 10 are arranged about a central hollow shaft 1 and are fed by pipes 11, the supply of the material to be treated being controlled by a valve 38 on a float 41, and a throttle - valve 42. The solids outlet 12 is turned inwards and upwards into the pipe 14 and is thus sealed. The liquid outlet pipe 28 passes upwards and outwards to a seal 31 and open trap 30 so that atmospheric pressure exists in the chamber 10 at about the region a a<1>. The liquid is delivered by a pipe 33 into a trough 34. The solid in the pipe 14 is removed by a worm 16 driven by gearing 18, 19, 21, 22 into a chamber 25. Any liquid separated in the pipe 14 is taken back into the chamber 10 by a pipe 45. In the modification shown in Fig. 3, a single annular chamber 10<a> is employed. The material is delivered by pipes 11<a> into a trap 9<a>, a filter 50 being interposed between the chamber 10<a> and the clear liquid side. The pressure within the chamber is adjusted automatically by a piston or diaphragm controlled throttle-valve 38<a> arranged as shown, which controls the clear-liquid outlet 28<a>. The liquid is collected in a trough 34<a>. The separated solids pass around a sealing-bend 12<a>, and over a surface 14<a> to a filter 51, and are then delivered to a rotary trough 37<a> from which a stationary scraper 64 removes them. A pipe 53 removes liquid separated at the filter 51. A differentially rotating sleeve 20<a> carries scrapers 24<a>, 16<a>, and a brush 52 for facilitating the removal of deposited solids, and also a brush for cleaning the filter 50. For cleaning the machine, the valve 61 is closed, and the valve 62 opened. Clean water is introduced by a valve 63, and the machine is rotated. A pet cock 19<a> is provided to allow air to escape when the machine is being primed prior to rotation. In a modification of the construction shown in Fig. 3, the filter 50 and regulating- valve 38<a> are dispensed with.

Processing of gas streams
column13: Method and apparatus for removing material from a gas stream. The gas stream with entrained material is moved downwardly through a filter bed of loose filtering solids of not more than 1.4 millimeter size, simultaneously with the passage of liquid downwardly through the filter bed which wets the surfaces of the filtering solids. Backwashing at intervals cleans the surfaces of the filtering solids of material that has accumulated thereon.

column12: BURNER AIR PRE-HEATER
Improvements relating to the Tyres of Motor Road Vehicles for Preventing Side Slip.
column13: 6832. Ellam, W. H., and Ellis, E. T. March 21. Tyres, pneumatic &c.-That type of device for preventing side-slip described in Specification No. 16,401, A.D. 1905, in which chains are attached at the sides of a segmental tread band or cover so as to come into contact with the road only when slipping tends to occur, is applied to tyres with continuous covers or bands. In the form shown in Figs. 2 and 3, rows of chain a are secured by rivets c of bent metal embracing the straight parts of the links, which are bent over behind a fabric layer h embedded in the continuous cover or band, the parts being vulcanized together when in position. In another form, the rivets for securing the chains comprise short lengths of metal tubing flattened to leave two eyes at each side, the eyes on one side embracing the links, and those on the other being threaded on a cord or the like embedded in the cover or band. A raised part of the tread may be provided between the rows of chain, or the chains may lie in grooves in the tread. The tread may be grooved or corrugated. The chains may be so arranged that they only come into action when the tyre is not fully inflated. According to the Provisional Specification, the central part of the tyre tread may be protected by studs or chains.

column12: OPTICAL COUPLING OF ADJACENT STRIPE CONTACT GEOMETRY SEMICONDUCTOR LASERS
column13: Adjacent stripe contact geometry semiconductor lasers are optically coupled if the stripe contacts are sufficiently close that the optical fields of adjacent lasers overlap; i.e., the field of one laser penetrates the active region of adjacent lasers and/or the fields of adjacent lasers mutually interact in the lossy region between lasers. In the case of two such coupled lasers, the combination oscillates at some frequency intermediate the natural frequencies of oscillation of the two lasers taken separately. Also disclosed are several embodiments employing a plurality of parallel stripe contacts electrically divided into two sets of complementary contacts, a separate current source being connected to each set. The two sets are formed by a physical separation between the corresponding contact segments, the shape of the separation obeying a prescribed functional relationship between contact length and contact position. When, for example, the functional relationship is linear, beam scanning is produced. When the relationship is parabolic, variable beam widths are produced.

column12: VALVE FOR INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINES
High speed, high accuracy parts counting system
column13: A high speed, high accuracy parts counting system is disclosed. The new system utilizes known types of centrifugal feeder devices with novel modifications relating to the sensing and control of individual workpieces, enabling workpieces to be counted and processed at much greater speeds than before, while equaling or improving accuracy. The new system makes no attempt to separate individual workpieces for counting purposes, enabling operations to be carried out at greater speeds. Counting of workpieces in an unseparated group of such workpieces is accomplished by electronic measurement of movement of the centrifugal feeder between the leading and trailing edges of a group of unseparated workpieces. The counting of a predetermined number of workpieces is thus a function of the counting of pulses and is independent of the separation or non-separation of workpieces during counting. Provision is also made for high speed collection and discharge of counted groups of workpieces.

column12: Improvements relating to containers maintained under internal pressure
column13: 820,175. Fire-extinguishers. PYRENE CO. Ltd. May 31, 1957 [June 11, 1956], No. 17990/56. Claps 47 [Also in Groups XXVIII and XXIX] A pressurized container 1 for fire extinguishing medium is provided with a brittle tubular closure member 4 Which must be broken to release the 'contents and which is enclosed by a cover 8 that is closed except for an outlet 12 through which the contents of the container are discharged, the cover 8 being mounted to slide and in so doing to break the closure member 4. The closure member, which comprises a spigot 4 screwed into a cylindrical boss 2 on the container 1, has a blind bore 5 which at its open end registers with a bore 3 which leads to the interior of the container. The spigot is weakened by a circumferential notch 6, and the cover 8 is provided with an inclined wall 11 so that when the cover is knocked downwards, the wall 11 engages the top of the spigot and. breaks it along the notch 6. To prevent accidental operation of the extinguisher the cover 9 is held in the inoperative position by means of a withdrawable pin 29. A pin 19 in the cover 8 engaging a slot 18 in the boss 2, prevents the cover from being blown off by pressure of escaping liquid. A jet forming device 17 in the discharge opening. 12 is formedwith a hole 13 on one side overlapped by two holes 14 onthe other side Which serve to. produce impinging jets. A stop 15 in the cover 8 prevents the broken end of the closure member from blocking the opening 12. The spigot 4 is constructed to serve as a filled plug, the thread thereon being axially interrupted to form a slot to admit gas to the container so long as the spigot is not screwed fully home.

Apparatuses and methods for surgical navigation
column13: Imaging, object tracking, integration apparatus 100  has tracking system 1,  imaging system 3,  communication system 5  and integration system 7.  Tracking system 1  locates objects in 3-dimensions and determines respective poses. Imaging system 3  acquires object images. Integration system 7  correlates 3-dimensional poses. User communication system 5  provides information, such as images, sounds, or control signals to the user or other automated systems. Image acquisition techniques include X-ray imaging and ultrasound imaging. Images can be acquired from digital files. Imaging system 3  creates a calibrated, geometrically corrected two-dimensional image 110, 210 . Correlation system 7  can receive instructions from a practitioner to create, destroy, and edit the properties of a guard. Communications system 5  displays images and calculations to a practitioner, such as a surgeon. Methods can determine geometrical relations between guards and/or present to a practitioner projections of forms of guards.

column12: Magnetic resonance surgery using heat waves produced with a laser fiber or focussed ultrasound.
column13: Surgery is performed with pulsed heat means that selectively destroys tissue in a region within a patient. The size of the region destroyed is dependent upon the frequency of the pulses of the pulsed heat means and thermal conductivity of the tissue of the patient. The pulsed heat means can be a coherent optical source (80) that is guided by laser fiber to the tissue to be destroyed. In another embodiment the pulsed heat means is a focussed ultrasound transducer that dissipates ultrasonic energy at a focal point within the region of tissue to be destroyed. A magnetic resonance imaging system (10,20,30) employing a temperature sensitive pulse sequence creates an image of the tissue and the region being heated to allow a surgeon to alter the position of the pulsed heat means or vary the pulse frequency.

column12: Thin-film imaging recording contructions incorporating matallic inorganic layers and optical interference structures
column13: Constructions useful as lithographic printing plates include metallic inorganic layers exhibiting both hydrophilicity and substantial durability at very thin application levels. These materials ablatively absorb imaging radiation, thereby facilitating direct imaging without chemical development. They can also be used to form optical interference structures which, in addition to providing color, likewise absorb imaging radiation and ablate in response to imaging pulses.

Pharmaceutical compositions
column13: The invention comprises a compound or complex of dextran and chloral. In one embodiment, chloral or chloral hydrate is heated with dextran to 80-90 DEG C. suitably in an anhydrous medium, to form a dextran-chloral reaction product, usually containing 1-2 moles of chloral per glucose unit of dextran if a stoichemical excess of chloral is used. In an example, dextran (mol. wt. 5000-10,000) is suspended in anhydrous chloral, and the mixture stirred at 80-90 DEG C. The dextran-chloral reaction product is isolated by pouring the hot suspension into petroleum. The reaction product, in conjunction with pharmaceutical carriers, forms therapeutic compositions (see Division A5).ALSO:Hypnotic pharmaceutical compositions comprise a compound or complex of dextran and chloral in combination with a carrier. The dextranchloral compound or complex is made by heating together dextran and chloral or chloral hydrate, (Division C3) and usually contains 1-2 moles of chloral per glucose unit of dextran. The compositions may be in the form of aqueous or oil solutions, suspensions or emulsions, linctus, lotions, creams, pastes coated or uncoated tablets or capsules.

Parts unloader for top delivery dies
column13: A portable and easily adjustable parts unloader which is usable with different types and sizes of power presses is provided by driving a parts remover tray through a simple cable and sheave arrangement and by mounting the parts remover on top of a telescopic post whose effective length is varied hydraulically so the height of the loader is easily changed for different presses. The post, in turn, is mounted on a wheeled cart so it is easily moved from one press to the other by a single operator. By using a simple pulley, the stroke of the parts remover tray is directly proportional to the stroke of the press ram, but the stroke of the tray can be made greater than and/or faster than the stroke of the ram by using a compound pulley in which the two pulley parts have different effective diameters.

Circuit model generation and circuit model testing
column13: A test bench generation technique is described in which a simulation of test operation is performed using a full subsystem circuit model 2  and full surrounding circuit models 4, 6,  and 8.  The input and output signals are recorded as a print on change file 10.  This print on change file is used in combination with a classification of whether signals are inputs, outputs or bidirectional and associated rules for outputs and bidirectional signals when outputs to establish a reduced model concentrating on the interaction between the subsystyem circuit under test and the surrounding circuit elements. This reduced model 34  replays input data and applies rules to output data rather than actually modelling the full behaviour of the surrounding circuits. The rules associated with output signals can involve time windows, strobing relationships, settling times and settled times amongst other characteristics.

column13: A pill dispenser mechanism is provided in which a multilayered compartment is releasably attachable to a receptacle for pills in such a way that pills may be selectively advanced into one compartment, then by selective advancement of one of the compartment layers transfer the pill from the first compartment into a discharge compartment to permit sequential recovery of pills therefrom. In order to accommodate different sized pills, the compartments may be provided with different sized openings to conform to the substantial size and configuration of the pill. Electrical contact switches may be associated with the compartments to sense for the purpose of recording the movement of a pill between one or more, or a combination of both, compartments.

column12: ANGULAR RATE SENSOR NOZZLE
column13: An angular rate sensor is provided having a specially shaped nozzle (28) which shapes the velocity profile of a gas stream passing through a nozzle so that a linear portion of the profile impinges upon the resistive elements (53,54) of the sensor even when large angular rates of turn in a plane of sensitivity are encountered. The nozzle (28) is generally rectangularly shaped having a pair of parallel sides arranged perpendicularly to the resistive elements (53,54) of the sensor and a pair of connecting sides.

column12: ORGANE DE FIXATION IMPERDABLE
column13:
L'invention concerne un organe de fixation à vis imperdable.
Il comporte une vis (30) montée au moyen d'une virole (60) sur un panneau (80) et pouvant être serrée à la main, mais nécessitant un outil pour être desserrée une fois qu'elle a été serrée à la main. Un bouton (20) est monté coaxialement avec la vis et une roue d'encliquetage (40) est montée entre eux de manière à permettre à la vis d'être serrée dans le sens des aiguilles d'une montre au moyen du bouton. Lorsque l'on fait tourner le bouton dans le sens inverse, la roue d'encliquetage est dégagée de façon à ne pas transmettre cette rotation, ce qui nécessite d'utiliser un outil s'engageant dans l'empreinte (36) de la vis pour desserrer cette dernière.
Domaine d'application: montage de portes, de capots et autres éléments de carters pour appareils électroniques, etc.

column12: Methods and systems for wireless communication in a reflective environment
column13: A method for wireless communication in a reflective environment includes (a) receiving first wireless signals at a first antenna assembly at least partially via a first reflective environment, (b) generating a first electrical signal from a first antenna element of the first antenna assembly in response to the first wireless signals, the first antenna element having a first polarization, (c) generating a second electrical signal from a second antenna element of the first antenna assembly in response to the first wireless signals, the second antenna element having a second polarization different from the first polarization, (d) shifting phase of at least one of the first electrical signal and the second electrical signal, and (e) after shifting phase, combining at least the first electrical signal and the second electrical signal to generate a combined electrical signal.

column12: Methods of isolating specific compounds from supramammary lymph node tissue
column13: Methods of forming proteinaceous products such as cell culture supplement capable of supporting the growth and culturing of cells, tissue, and organs, are generally disclosed. One method generally provides for the collection of the internal tissue of an animal, such as a bovine, and the processing of the internal tissue to degrade and/or lyse the tissue components. A cell culture supplement or other proteinaceous product can be prepared from the processed tissue. A proteinaceous product can include, for example, a complete protein profile of the tissue or only certain biological factors extracted from the tissue. Collected internal tissue can be lymphatic tissue such as the supramammary glands of a dairy or beef cow or the thymus gland of a veal calf.

column12: ELEKTRONISCHER PROGRAMMFÜHRER MIT UNTERSTÜTZUNG UMFASSENDER PROGRAMMINHALTE
column13: An electronic program guide that assists a user to navigate through a variety of digital and analog feeds made available by digital television technology is provided. Features such as allowing the user to purchase items, allowing the user to choose the content of the display screen, enabling more efficient use of black areas, among others are provided. Default settings based on prior user settings is provided to allow for an automatically customized environment. This automatic customization may entail, for example, the automatic resizing of windows based on the user's prior preferences. Also provided is a feature that allows for the automatic activation of a local or remote application through the user's set-top box based on the content currently being viewed.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE GUIDE WITH SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-server electronic program guide
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system in which an interactive television program guide provides a plurality of users with an opportunity to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.

SOLUTION: The plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides the plurality of users with VCR-like control over a plurality of programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom the plurality of programs may be recorded.

column12: Interactive television program guide system having multiple devices within a household
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programms that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the prorams. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM T;;LEMMONS THOMAS R
column16: UNITED VIDEO PROPERTIES, INC. (2011-06-29)

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system in which server resources are used to provide enhanced program guide functions.SOLUTION: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on a user television apparatus. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by a program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedule reminders, schedule program recordings, and parentally lock programs on the basis of the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generate viewing recommendations, target advertising, and collect program rating information on the basis of the viewing histories.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1
column15: MICHAEL D ELLIS;;THOMAS R LEMMONS;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings); etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications; home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: sistema de guia de programa de televisão interativo no qual programas de televisão são gravados e reproduzidos sob demanda por um servidor de mídia remoto para um número de usuários e um método para utilização no sistema
column13: sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo e método para utilização em um sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo. a presente invenção refere-se a um sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo (10). um guia de programas de televisão interativo provê os usuários com um oportunidade de selecionar os programas para gravar em um servidor de mídia remoto (24). os programas podem também ser gravados em um servidor de mídia local (29). o guia de programas provê os usuários com um controle como vcr sobre os programas que são repro-duzidos dos servidores de mídia e sobre as cópias colocadas em cache em tempo real dos programas. o guia de programas também provê os usuários com uma oportunidade de designar recebedores presentes para quem os programas podem ser gravados.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system that provides a further enhanced program guide function using a resource from a server.

SOLUTION: In the client-server interactive television program guide system, an interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions processed by the program guide server. Based on these expressions, the program guide server can provide program guide data, schedule reminders, schedule program recordings, and locks programs. Users' viewing log can be tracked. The program guide server can analyze the viewing log. Based on this viewing log, the program guide server creates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program rating information.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM USING REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: To provide an interactive television program guide system, the interactive television program guide providing a plurality of users with opportunities to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.SOLUTION: A plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. A program guide provides a plurality of users with VCR-like control over a plurality of programs that are played back from the media server and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with opportunities to designate gift recipients for whom the plurality of programs may be recorded.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 29

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: - 60 The present invention relates to a method for use in an interactive program guide system for providing a customized viewing experience to a user. The method 5 comprises generating a viewing history database, in turn, comprising program listings and associated program criteria. At least one of the associated program criteria is determined from the viewing history database that meets a user preference profile. A set of programs 10 not yet watched is determined from a program listing database. The method involves applying the at least one of the associated program criteria to the set of programs not yet watched to generate at least one personal viewing recommendation. The personal viewing recommendation is 15 provided to a user. column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD.
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system and to make an interactive television program guide provide a plurality of users with an opportunity to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.

SOLUTION: The plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides the plurality of users with VCR-like control over the plurality of programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom the plurality of programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a program guide system which allows a user to direct a server to record a particular program for playing back the program on demand later.

SOLUTION: A main facility 12 provides a program guide data from a program guide data source 14 to an interactive program guide television equipment 17 via a communications link 18. It is preferred that each of many interactive program guide television equipment 17s is linked to the main facility 12 via respectival communication link 18. The link 18 may be a satellite link, a telephone network link, a cable or optical fiber link, a microwave link, the Internet link, a combination of those links, or any other appropriate communication link. If a transmission of a data signal with a video signal through the link 18 is requested, a relatively high bandwidth link such as the satellite link is normally suitable than a relatively low bandwidth link such as the telephone line.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2004,JPO&NCIPI
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM PROVIDED WITH MULTIPLE DEVICES IN SINGLE HOUSEHOLD
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.

SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings by using a given one of interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set-up list features (for example, audio and video and language settings), and the like. The operation of applications, such as Web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, and the like, is also coordinated.

column12: SISTEMA DE GUIA INTERACTIVO DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISION QUE TIENEN MULTIPLES DISPOSITIVOS DENTRO DE UNA CASA.
column13: Un método para utilizar un sistema de guía de programa de televisión interactiva con base en un primer y segundo dispositivo de equipos de televisión de usuario dentro de una casa, dicho primer y segundo dispositivos de equipo de televisión de usuario que implementan las primeras y segundas guías de programas de televisión interactiva respectivos, en donde el segundo dispositivo de equipo de televisión comprende un dispositivo de grabación, el método comprende: Interconectar el primer y segundo dispositivo de equipo de televisión de usuario mediante una ruta de comunicación; Recibir la primera guía de programa de televisión interactiva una selección de usuario de un programa para grabar; Coordinar el primer y segundo dispositivo de equipo de televisión de usuario sobre la ruta de comunicaciones, de tal manera que la selección sobre la primera guía del programa de televisión interactivo es efectiva sobre la segunda guía de programa de televisión interactivo; Grabar bajo el control de la segunda guía de programa de televisión interactivo, el programa seleccionado en el dispositivo de grabación, en donde el segundo dispositivo de equipo de televisión de usuario esta en un sitio remoto del primer dispositivo del equipo de televisión de usuario.

column12: Sistema guia de programas de televisão interativo que tem diversos dispositivos dentro de uma residência
column13: Patente de Invenção: <B>"SISTEMA GUIA DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISãO INTERATIVO QUE TEM DIVERSOS DISPOSITIVOS DENTRO DE UMA RESIDêNCIA"<D>. Um sistema guia de programas de televisão interativo baseado em diversos dispositivos de equipamento de televisão do usuário em uma única residência é fornecido. O sistema fornece a um usuário uma oportunidade para estabelecer ajustes de guia de programas com um dado dos guias de programas de televisão interativos. O sistema coordena a operação dos guias de programas de televisão interativos de modo que os ajustes de guia de programas que foram estabelecidos com o dado guia de programas de televisão interativo são utilizados pelos outros guias de programas de televisão interativos. Os ajustes de guia de programas incluem características relacionadas a ajustar lembretes de programas, perfis, características de gravação de programa, características de mensagens, características de favoritos, características de controle parental, características de ajuste de guia de programas, (por exemplo ajustes de áudio e vídeo, ou de língua), e etc. A operação de aplicativos tais como aplicativos de navegador de rede, aplicativos de compra doméstica, aplicativos de banco doméstico, aplicativos de jogos, e etc pode também ser coordenada.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.

column12: Client-server electronic program guide
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L
column16: ROVI GUIDES, INC. (2018-01-03);;UNITED VIDEO PROPERTIES, INC. (2011-06-29)

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM USING REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system, the interactive television program guide providing a plurality of users with opportunities to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.SOLUTION: A plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. A program guide provides a plurality of users with VCR-like control over a plurality of programs that are played back from the media server and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with opportunities to designate gift recipients for whom the plurality of programs may be recorded.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 29

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system in which server resources are used to provide enhanced program guide features.SOLUTION: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on a user television apparatus. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by a program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedule reminders, schedule program recordings, and parentally lock programs on the basis of the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generate viewing recommendations, target advertising, and collect program ratings information on the basis of the viewing histories.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Interactive television program guide system having multiple devices within a household
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN ONE HOUSEHOLD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention comprises a method. The method comprises using a server to store a viewing history. The method further comprises determining, via the server, a set of media assets not yet watched based on the viewing history. In addition, the method involves generating at least one personal viewing recommendation by applying, via the server, a user preference profile to the set of media assets not yet watched to generate at least one personal viewing recommendation. The method also involves transmitting, via the server, the personal viewing recommendation for display to a user.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: - 58 The present invention relates to a method for using an interactive program guide. The method comprises 5 determining which programming at least one user has watched based on a viewing history. The viewing history includes monitored interactions with the interactive program guide for the at least one user. The method also involves generating a listing of programming other than 10 the programming the user has watched. The generated listing is displayed. column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system allowing a user to reproduce a program later in an on-demand manner by instructing a sever to picture-record the specified program.

SOLUTION: The interactive television program guide provides the user with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. The programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides the user with VCR-like control programs that are reproduced from the media servers and real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides the user with an opportunity to designate a recipient of a gift in which a plurality of programs can be picture-recorded to a plurality of the users.

column13: patente de invenção: <b>"sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo baseado em servidor de cliente com gravação de servidor remoto"<d>. um sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo é fornecido. um guia de programas de televisão interativo provê os usuários com um oportunidade de selecionar os programas para gravar em um servidor de mídia remoto. os programas podem também ser gravado em um servidor de mídia local. o guia de programas provê os usuários com um controle como vcr sobre os programas que são reproduzidos dos servidores de mídia e sobre as cópias colocadas em cache em tempo real dos programas. o guia de programas também provê os usuários com uma oportunidade de designar recebedores presentes para quem os programas podem ser gravados.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN SINGLE HOUSEHOLD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting includes features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: Client-server electronic program guide
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L
column16: TV GUIDE INC. (2015-06-29);;LEWEI GUIDE COMPANY (2015-06-29);;UV CORP. (2015-06-29)

column12: Sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo baseado em servidor de cliente com gravação de servidor remoto
column13: Patente de Invenção: <B>"SISTEMA DE GUIA DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISãO INTERATIVO BASEADO EM SERVIDOR DE CLIENTE COM GRAVAçãO DE SERVIDOR REMOTO"<D>. Um sistema de guia de programas de televisão interativo é fornecido. Um guia de programas de televisão interativo provê os usuários com um oportunidade de selecionar os programas para gravar em um servidor de mídia remoto. Os programas podem também ser gravado em um servidor de mídia local. O guia de programas provê os usuários com um controle como VCR sobre os programas que são reproduzidos dos servidores de mídia e sobre as cópias colocadas em cache em tempo real dos programas. O guia de programas também provê os usuários com uma oportunidade de designar recebedores presentes para quem os programas podem ser gravados.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R
column16: TV GUIDE, INC. (US) (2016-01-05);;UV CORP. (US) (2015-12-22);;ROVI GUIDES, INC. (US) (2016-01-19)

column12: Interactive television program guide system and method for recording program
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM PROVIDED WITH MULTIPLE DEVICES IN SINGLE HOUSEHOLD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings by using a given one of interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include functions related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording functions, messaging functions, favorite functions, parallel control functions, program guide set-up list functions (for example, audio and video and language settings), and the like. The operation of applications, such as Web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, and the like, is also coordinated.

column12: método para uso em um sistema de guia de programação interativo para televisão cliente-servidor e sistema de guia de programação interativo para televisão cliente-servidor
column13: resumo patente de invenção: "método para uso em um sistema de guia de programação interativo para televisão cliente-servidor e sistema de guia de programação interativo para televisão cliente-servidor". um sistema (17) de guia de programação interativo para televisão cliente-servidor é provido. um cliente de guia de programação interativo para televisão é implementado no equipamento de televisão do usuário (22). o guia de programação interativo para televisão provê os usuários com uma oportunidade para definir expressões que são processadas pelo servidor de guia de programação. o servidor de guia de programação (25) pode prover dados de guia de programação, programar lembretes, programar gravações de programas e bloquear programas por controle paterno com base nas expressões. os históricos de assistência dos usuários podem ser rastreados. o servidor de guia de programação (25) pode analisar os históricos de assistência e gerar recomendações de assistência, dirigir publicidade e coletar informações a respeito de índices de audiência com base nos históricos de assistência.

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract A method comprising: receiving an expression with a server, wherein the expression was defined by a user at a user equipment; processing the expression with the server (25) to find media assets that satisfy the expression; and scheduling with the server (25) the media assets that satisfy the expression for recording.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention relates to a method for use in a client-server system having at least one server. The method comprises receiving from a user equipment, user preferences defined by a user using the user equipment. The user preferences include a plurality of user preference attribute types having a plurality of preference attributes. The user preferences comprise a designated preference level, including a level of dislike, for at least one preference attribute of at least one preference attribute type. The method also involves processing the user preferences with the at least one server to find media asset data based on the user preferences, and transmitting the media asset data to the user equipment.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Sistema de guía de programas de televisión interactiva basado en cliente-servidor con grabación en servidor remoto
column13: Método para su uso en un sistema de guía de programas de televisión interactiva que proporciona a unapluralidad de usuarios acceso a programas en una pluralidad de equipos de usuario configurados parapresentar vídeo desde un servidor, comprendiendo el método: proporcionar vídeo a la pluralidad de equipos de usuario desde un dispositivo de almacenamiento;grabar un programa en el servidor, en respuesta a recibir una petición de grabación para grabar elprograma, en el que la petición de grabación se genera por un usuario que usa una guía de programasde televisión interactiva en un equipo de usuario de la pluralidad de equipos de usuario;crear una entrada para el programa grabado en un directorio de usuario de programas grabados por elusuario; recibir una petición de borrado generada por el usuario que usa la guía de programas de televisióninteractiva y, en respuesta a la petición de borrado; borrar la entrada para el programa en el directorio de usuario, si más de un usuario había pedido lagrabación del programa seleccionado; y borrar el programa del servidor si sólo un usuario había pedido la grabación del programa seleccionado yactualizar el directorio de usuario en consecuencia.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM T;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R
column16: ROVI GUIDES INC (2014-11-24);;TV GUIDE INC (2014-11-24);;UV CORP (2014-11-24);;UNITED VIDEO PROPERTIES INC (1999-07-01)

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD.
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: Interactive television program guide system having multiple devices within a household
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system in which server resources are used to provide enhanced program guide features.SOLUTION: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on a user television apparatus. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by a program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedule reminders, schedule program recordings, and parentally lock programs on the basis of the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generate viewing recommendations, target advertising, and collect program ratings information on the basis of the viewing histories.
column15: MICHAEL D ELLIS;;THOMAS R LEMMONS;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a client-server interactive television program guide system that provides opportunity for selecting a plurality of programs to be recorded in a remote media server, to a plurality of users.

SOLUTION: A plurality of programs may also be recorded in a local media server. A program guide provides VCR-like control on the plurality of programs reproduced from a media server and copies cached real-time of the plurality of programs to the plurality of users. The program guide also provides opportunity for designating a gift receiver for whom the plurality of programs can be recorded to the plurality of users.

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention relates to a video guidance system for identifying unviewed video files associated with 5 episodes of a series of episodes. The system comprises a server, comprising: a database configured to store a plurality of video files, wherein each video file of the plurality of video files is associated with a respective episode of a series of episodes and is associated with a 10 respective program listing data structure, and a plurality of viewing history data structures, wherein each viewing history data structure of the plurality of viewing history data structures is associated with a respective user of a plurality of users and comprises 15 video file identifiers of video files previously viewed by the respective user. The system further comprises a control circuitry configured to receive, from a user equipment, a first request associated with a first user of the plurality of users, wherein the first request is 20 for a first video file associated with a first video file identifier and associated with an episode of the series of episodes; search the database for the first video file; transmit, to the user equipment, the first video file; search the database for a first viewing history 25 data structure of the plurality of viewing history data structures, wherein the first viewing history data structure is associated with the first user; update the first viewing history data structure to include the first video file identifier; receive a second request 30 associated with the first user, wherein the second request is for a list of video files, wherein each video file of the list of video files is associated with a respective episode of the series of episodes; search the database to identify a first set of program listing data structures associated with video files that are associated with the series of episodes; search the database, based on the first viewing history data structure, to identify a first subset of the first set, 5 wherein the first subset includes program listing data structures associated with video files that have been previously viewed by the first user; compare the first set to the first subset; identify, based on the comparison, a second subset of the first set, wherein the 10 second subset includes program listing data structures associated with video files that have not been previously viewed by the first user; update the program listing data structures of the second subset to indicate that each respective video file associated with the program listing 15 data structures of the second subset have not been previously viewed by the first user; and transmit, to the user equipment, a response to the second request wherein the response comprises the list of video files, wherein each video file of the list of video files is associated 20 with a respective program listing data structure of the second subset.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.
