column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention relates to a method comprising receiving an expression with a server. The expression was defined by a user at a user equipment. The method involves processing the expression with the server to find media assets that satisfy the expression. The method involves scheduling with the server the media assets that satisfy the expression for recording.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN SINGLE HOUSEHOLD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting includes features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: MICHAEL D ELLIS;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;THOMAS R LEMMONS

column12: Client-server electronic program guide
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system, and causes the interactive television program guide to provide an opportunity to select a plurality of programs to a plurality of users in order to record in a remote media server.

SOLUTION: The plurality of the programs may also be recorded in a local media server. The program guide provides VCR (Video Cassette Recorder) like control on the plurality of the programs reproduced from the media server and a copy of the plurality of the programs cashed in real time to a plurality of users. The program guide also provides opportunity to specify gift recipients who can record the plurality of the programs to the plurality of the users.

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: - 58 The present invention relates to a method for using an interactive program guide. The method comprises 5 determining which programming at least one user has watched based on a viewing history. The viewing history includes monitored interactions with the interactive program guide for the at least one user. The method also involves generating a listing of programming other than 10 the programming the user has watched. The generated listing is displayed. column12: Client-server based interactive television progrm guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM T;;LEMMONS THOMAS R
column16: UNITED VIDEO PROPERTIES, INC. (2011-06-29)

column12: Interactive Television Program Guide System Having Multiple Devices Within A Household
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column14: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: SISTEMA DE GUIA DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISION INTERATIVA QUE TIENEN MULTIPLES DISPOSITIVOS EN UN DOMICILIO PARTICULAR.
column13: Un sistema de guía de programas de televisión interactiva basado en una pluralidad de dispositivos de equipos de televisión de usuario (44, 60-63, 66-69, 80-83, 90-92, 94, 96, 98, 106109, 109A y 109B, 413, 414) en los que se encuentran implementadas una pluralidad de guías de programas de televisión interactiva, caracterizado: porque la pluralidad de dispositivos de equipos de televisión interactiva de usuario (44, 60-63, 66-69, 80-83, 90-92, 94, 96, 98, 106-109, 109A y 109B, 413, 414) están localizados en un solo domicilio particular; y porque la pluralidad de dispositivos de equipos de televisión de usuario (44, 60-63, 66-69, 8083, 90-92, 94, 96, 98, 106-109, 109A y 109B, 413, 414) están interconectados mediante trayectos de comunicaciones (64, 70, 85, 99, 405, 415, 700); y porque la pluralidad de dispositivos de equipos de televisión de usuario (44, 60-63, 66-69, 8083, 90-92, 94, 96, 98, 106-109, 109A y 109B, 413, 414) están configurados para: proporcionar una oportunidad a un usuario deajustar las configuraciones de la guía de programas con una guía dada de la pluralidad de guías de programas de televisión interactiva; y configurado para coordinar la operación de la pluralidad de guías de programas de televisión interactiva, a fin de que la pluralidad de guías de programas de televisión interactiva se ajusten con la guía dada de la pluralidad de guías de programas de televisión interactiva que se utilicen al menos en otra guía de la pluralidad de guías de programas de televisión interactiva durante la operación de la pluralidad de guías de programas interactivos.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-server electronic program guide
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system, and causes the interactive television program guide to provide an opportunity to select a plurality of programs to a plurality of users in order to record in a remote media server.

SOLUTION: The plurality of the programs may also be recorded in a local media server. The program guide provides VCR (Video Cassette Recorder) like control on the plurality of the programs reproduced from the media server and a copy of the plurality of the programs cashed in real time to a plurality of users. The program guide also provides opportunity to specify gift recipients who can record the plurality of the programs to the plurality of the users.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDING SYSTEM BASED ON CLIENT SERVER USING REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a program guiding system, by which a user reproduces a specific program on demand later by the user's indicating a server to record the program with regard to an interactive television program guiding system, in detail, a television program guiding system by which the user records a plurality of programs and program guiding data on a medium server.

SOLUTION: A method records the program using the interactive television program guide, and the method includes receiving a first user selection for recording a first television program in a digital recording apparatus, tuning a first tuner to a channel that corresponds to the first television program according to the receiving of the first user selection, recording an output of the first tuner in the digital recording apparatus, receiving a second user selection which records a second television program for its broadcasting time for overlapping at least partially a broadcasting time of the first television program in the digital recording apparatus, tuning a second tuner to the channel to correspond to the second television program according to the receiving of the second user selection, and recording the output of the second tuner, together with the output of the first tuner simultaneously in the digital recording apparatus.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2006,JPO&NCIPI
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract A method for use in a client-server system having at least one server, the method comprising: receiving from a user equipment, user preferences defined by a user using the user equipment, wherein: the user preferences include a plurality of user preference attribute types having a plurality of preference attributes, the user preferences comprise a designated preference level, including a level of dislike, for at least one preference attribute of at least one preference attribute type; and processing the user preferences with the at least one server to find media asset data based on the user preferences; and transmitting the media asset data to the user equipment.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Sistema de guía interactiva de programas de televisión que tiene múltiples dispositivos dentro de un hogar
column13: Un procedimiento para pedir un programa con una primera guía interactiva de programas en un primer dispositivo, que comprende: generar, usando la primera guía interactiva de programas en el primer dispositivo, una visualización de una pluralidad de listados de programas; recibir, de un usuario en el primer dispositivo usando la primera guía interactiva de programas en el primer dispositivo, una selección de usuario de un programa disponible para pedido, donde la primera incluye una selección de un listado de programas asociado con el programa de la pluralidad de listados de programas; y recibir, del usuario en el primer dispositivo usando la primera guía interactiva de programas, una selección de usuario de un segundo dispositivo, donde el primer dispositivo está en comunicación con el segundo, y donde: en respuesta a la selección de usuario del segundo dispositivo, el programa seleccionado se pone a disposición en una segunda guía interactiva de programas en el segundo dispositivo para consumo por el usuario, donde la segunda guía interactiva de programas genera una visualización de la pluralidad de listados de programas.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention relates to a method for use in an interactive program guide system for providing a 5 customized viewing experience to a user. The method comprises generating a viewing history for the user comprising program listings and associated program criteria. The viewing history is stored to a viewing history database. The method comprises determining at 10 least one of the associated program criteria from the viewing history that meets a user preference profile of the user. The at least one of the associated program criteria is applied to a program listings database to determine a first set of programs. The method comprises 15 determining from the first set of programs, a second set of programs not yet watched, to generate at least one personal viewing recommendation. The personal viewing recommendation is provided to the user.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract A method, for use in a client-server system, having at least one server, for tracking a user's viewing history, comprising: tracking a user's viewing history; storing the user's viewing history on the server; finding with the server, media assets that are similar to media assets in the user's viewing history; and transmitting commands to a user equipment to indicate on a display, media assets found by the server that are similar to media assets in the user's viewing history and that the user has not watched.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column12: Sistema de guía interactivo de programas de televisión que tiene múltiples dispositivos dentro de una casa
column13: Un método para operar dispositivos de equipo de televisión que comprende: permitir que un usuario ajuste las configuraciones de guía de programa de una primera guía de programa interactiva que se desarrolla en un primer en un primer dispositivo de equipo de televisión; transmitir las configuraciones de guía de programa ajustadas por el usuario en la primera guía de programa interactiva del primer dispositivo de equipo de televisión a un segundo dispositivo de equipo de televisión que ejecuta una segunda guía de programa interactiva siendo las configuraciones de guía de programa configuraciones de guía de programa para características de control paterno; y aplicar las configuraciones de guía de programa transmitidas a la segunda guía de programa interactiva, de tal manera que las configuraciones de guía de programa ajustadas por el usuario en la primera guía de programa interactiva sean efectivas sobre la segunda guía de programa interactiva y se utilicen por la segunda guía de programa interactiva para coordinar la operación de la funcionalidad de guía de programa de televisión interactiva en las primera y segunda guías de programa interactivas.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: REMOVAL OF EXCESS HALIDE IONS IN AQUEOUS LIQUID FORMULATIONS OF BASIC DYESTUFFS
column13: Mo-2974 VE-018 REMOVAL OF EXCESS HALIDE IONS IN AQUEOUS LIQUID FORMULATIONS OF BASIC DYESTUFFS There is disclosed a procedure for reducing the halide content of cationic or basic dyes and consequently the corrosive effect of aqueous formulations of these dyes on stainless steel. The dyes are incorporated into aqueous formulation which may range from neutral to acidic and exposed to an anionic exchange resin. Suitable techniques include stirring beads of the resin into the aqueous formulation and passing the aqueous formulation through an ion exchange column. Mo-2974
column15: MORRIS SUSAN M;;ELLIS MARGARET D;;THOMAS THOMAS J

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system, the interactive television program guide providing a plurality of users with opportunities to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.SOLUTION: The plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides the plurality of users with VCR-like control over a plurality of programs that are played back from the media server and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with opportunities to designate gift recipients for whom the programs may be recorded.
column15: MICHAEL D ELLIS;;THOMAS L WILLIAM;;THOMAS R LEMMONS

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention relates to a method for use in an interactive program guide system for providing a 5 customized viewing experience to a user. The method comprises generating a viewing history for the user comprising program listings and associated program criteria. The viewing history is stored to a viewing history database. The method comprises determining at 10 least one of the associated program criteria from the viewing history that meets a user preference profile of the user. The at least one of the associated program criteria is applied to a program listings database to determine a first set of programs. The method comprises 15 determining from the first set of programs, a second set of programs not yet watched, to generate at least one personal viewing recommendation. The personal viewing recommendation is provided to the user.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: SISTEMA DE GUIA DE PROGRAMAS DE TELEVISION INTERACTIVA BASADO EN UN SISTEMA DE CLIENTE-SERVIDOR CON GRABACION EN EL SERVIDOR REMOTO.
column13: Un método de utilización de un sistema de una guía de programas de televisión interactiva, en el cual los programas de televisión se graban y se reproducen bajo demanda por un servidor de medios remoto (24) para varios usuarios que tienen su equipo de televisión de usuario (22), en el que el método comprende las etapas de: generar una petición de grabación cuando el usuario indique el deseo de grabar un programa bajo demanda en el servidor de medios remoto; generar una petición de reproducción cuando el usuario indique el deseo de reproducir el programa grabado bajo demanda en el servidor de medios remoto; grabar el programa en respuesta a la petición de grabación en el servidor de medios remoto; reproducir el programa grabado en el servidor de medios remoto en respuesta a la petición de reproducción; y distribuir el programa grabado en el equipo de televisión de usuario, en el que el usuario haya indicado el deseo de reproducir el programa grabado en el servidor de medios remoto.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: GUIA ELECTRONICA DE PROGRAMACION CLIENTE-SERVIDOR.
column13: Método para ser utilizado en un sistema (17) interactivo de guía de programación de televisión con al menos un servidor (25) de la guía de programación y un cliente interactivo de la guía de programación de televisión que se ejecuta en el equipo (22) de televisión del usuario, comprendiendo el método las siguientes etapas: recibir de un usuario preferencias de usuario definidas utilizando el cliente interactivo de la guía de programación de televisión que está implementado en el equipo (22) de televisión del usuario sin que sea necesario que el usuario navegue por Internet, en el que: las preferencias de usuario incluyen una pluralidad de tipos de atributos de preferencia de usuario con una pluralidad de atributos de preferencia; y recibir del usuario preferencias de usuario definidas que comprenden un nivel (106) de preferencia designado para al menos un atributo (104) de preferencia de al menos un tipo de atributo de preferencia; incluyendo la preferencia de usuario designada recibida unnivel de desagrado; proporcionar las preferencias de usuario a al menos un servidor (25) de la guía de programación; procesar las preferencias de usuario con el al menos un servidor (25) de la guía de programación para hallar datos de la guía de programación basándose en las preferencias de usuario; y proporcionar datos de la guía de programación desde el al menos un servidor (25) de la guía de programación al cliente de la guía de programación de acuerdo con la preferencia de usuario.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE GUIDE WITH SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: Interactive television program guide system having multiple devices within a household
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system co-ordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features, (e.g. audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of application such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be co-ordinated.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R
column16: 2830 DE LA CRUZ BOULEVARD, SANTA CLARA 95050 CALIF (2012-04-03);;UNITED VIDEO PROPERTIES, INC. (2012-04-03)

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN A HOUSEHOLD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting includes features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide setup list features (e.g., audio and video and language settings); etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications; home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system and to make an interactive television program guide provide a plurality of users with an opportunity to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.

SOLUTION: A plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. A program guide provides a plurality of users with VCR-like control over a plurality of programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom the plurality of programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract The present invention relates to a method, for use in a client-server system, having at least one server, for tracking a user's viewing history. The method comprises tracking a user's viewing history, and storing the user's viewing history on the server. The method also comprises finding with the server, media assets that are similar to media assets in the user's viewing history. Commands are transmitted to a user equipment to indicate on a display, media assets found by the server that are similar to media assets in the user's viewing history and that the user has not watched.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column16: ROVI GUIDES, INC. (2015-11-30);;ROVI GUIDES, INC. (N.D.GES.D. STAATES DELAWARE, US (2015-11-24);;ROVI GUIDES, INC., US (2016-02-09)

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system which uses server resources to provide more fulfilling program guide functions.

SOLUTION: In the client-server interactive television program guide system 10, an interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.

COPYRIGHT: (C)2007,JPO&INPIT

column12: Guia de programação eletrônico tipo cliente-servidor
column13: Patente de Invenção: <B>"GUIA DE PROGRAMAçãO ELETRôNICO TIPO CLIENTE-SERVIDOR"<D>. Um sistema de guia de programação interativo para televisão cliente-servidor é provido. Um cliente de guia de programação interativo para televisão é implementado no equipamento de televisão do usuário. O guia de programação interativo para televisão provê os usuários com uma oportunidade para definir expressões que são processadas pelo servidor de guia de programação. O servidor de guia de programação pode prover dados de guia de programação, programar lembretes, programar gravações de programas e bloquear programas por controle paterno com base nas expressões. Os históricos de assistência dos usuários podem ser rastreados. O servidor de guia de programação pode analisar os históricos de assistência e gerar recomendações de assistência, dirigir publicidade e coletar informações a respeito de índices de audiência com base nos históricos de assistência.

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: Interactive television program guide system having multiple devices within a household
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system co-ordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features, (e.g. audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of application such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be co-ordinated.

Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features, (e.g. audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of application such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be co-ordinated.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER ELECTRONIC PROGRAM GUIDE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system in which server resources are used to provide enhanced program guide features.SOLUTION: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on a user television apparatus. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by a program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parental locks programs on the basis of the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program rating information on the basis of the viewing histories.
column15: MICHAEL D ELLIS;;THOMAS R LEMMONS;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: Interactive television program guide system having multiple devices within a household
column13: An interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household is provided. The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.

column12: CLIENT SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system that provides an opportunity for selecting a plurality of programs to be recorded in a remote media server, to a plurality of users.

SOLUTION: A plurality of programs may also be recorded in a local media server. A program guide provides VCR-like control on the plurality of programs reproduced from a media server and copies cached in real time of the plurality of programs to the plurality of users. The program guide also provides opportunity for designating a gift receiver for whom the plurality of programs can be recorded to the plurality of users.

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-server based interactive television program guide system with remote server recording
column13: An interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to select programs for recording on a remote media server. Programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides users with VCR-like control over programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the programs. The program guide also provides users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom programs may be recorded.

column12: Client-Server Electronic Program Guide
column13: Abstract A method comprising: using a server to store a viewing history; determining, via the server, a set of media assets not yet watched based on the viewing history; applying, via the server, a user preference profile to the set of media assets not yet watched to generate at least one personal viewing recommendation; and transmitting, via the server, the personal viewing recommendation for display to a user.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;LEMMONS THOMAS R;;THOMAS WILLIAM L

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES WITHIN SINGLE HOUSEHOLD
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a single household.SOLUTION: The system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system coordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide setting includes features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorites features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc. may also be coordinated.
column15: MICHAEL D ELLIS;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;THOMAS R LEMMONS

column12: SISTEMA DE GUIA DE PROGRAMACION DE TELEVISION INTERACTIVA BASADA EN UNA DISPOSICION CLIENTE-SERVIDOR, CON GRABACION EN UN SERVIDOR REMOTO.
column13: Un método para utilizar en un sistema de guía de programación de televisión interactiva en el cual los programas de televisión son grabados y reproducidos a la carta por un servidor de medios remoto (24) para una cantidad de usuarios, donde el método consta de: permitir que un usuario indique al menos un programa para grabar por medio del servidor de medios remoto (24); permitir que el usuario indique su deseo de acceder a un directorio de listados de programas de los programas grabados por el servidor de medios remoto (24) donde se grabaron los programas en respuesta a la indicación del usuario de grabar los programas con el servidor de medios remoto; y proporcionar el directorio de listados de programas en respuesta a la indicación del usuario de acceder al directorio de listados de programas.
column15: ELLIS MICHAEL D;;THOMAS WILLIAM L;;LEMMONS THOMAS R

column12: Removal of excess halide ions in aqueous liquid formulations of basic dyestuffs
column13: There is disclosed a procedure for reducing the halide content of cationic or basic dyes and consequently the corrosive effect of aqueous formulations of these dyes on stainless steel. The dyes are incorporated into aqueous formulation which may range from neutral to acidic and exposed to an anionic exchange resin. Suitable techniques include stirring beads of the resin into the aqueous formulation and passing the aqueous formulation through an ion exchange column.
column15: MORRIS SUSAN M;;ELLIS MARGARET D;;THOMAS THOMAS J
column16: MOBAY CORPORATION A CORP. OF NEW JERSEY (1987-08-03)

column12: CLIENT-SERVER BASED INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM WITH REMOTE SERVER RECORDING
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system and to make an interactive television program guide provide a plurality of users with an opportunity to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.

SOLUTION: The plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. The program guide provides the plurality of users with VCR-like control over the plurality of programs that are played back from the media servers and over real-time cached copies of the plurality of programs. The program guide also provides the plurality of users with an opportunity to designate gift recipients for whom the plurality of programs may be recorded.

column12: INTERACTIVE TELEVISION PROGRAM GUIDE SYSTEM HAVING MULTIPLE DEVICES IN HOUSEHOLD
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system based on multiple user television equipment devices in a household.

SOLUTION: This system provides a user with an opportunity to adjust program guide settings with a given one of the interactive television program guides. The system co-ordinates the operation of the interactive television program guides so that the program guide settings that were adjusted with the given interactive television program guide are used by the other interactive television program guides. Program guide settings include features related to setting program reminders, profiles, program recording features, messaging features, favorite features, parental control features, program guide set up features (e.g., audio and video and language settings), etc. The operation of applications such as web browser applications, home shopping applications, home banking applications, game applications, etc., may also be co-ordinated.

column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an interactive television program guide system, the interactive television program guide providing a plurality of users with opportunities to select a plurality of programs for recording on a remote media server.SOLUTION: The plurality of programs may also be recorded on a local media server. column12: Client-server electronic program guide
column13: A client-server interactive television program guide system is provided. An interactive television program guide client is implemented on user television equipment. The interactive television program guide provides users with an opportunity to define expressions that are processed by the program guide server. The program guide server may provide program guide data, schedules reminders, schedules program recordings, and parentally locks programs based on the expressions. Users' viewing histories may be tracked. The program guide server may analyze the viewing histories and generates viewing recommendations, targets advertising, and collects program ratings information based on the viewing histories.

column12: Wave pool curbing system
column15: ELLIS HERBERT S;;DELP THOMAS W;;DUNN JAMES F;;ELLIS KENNETH L

column12: WAVE POOL CURBING SYSTEM
column13: A foam-like panel (10) is provided which may be removably attached to a pool deck (30) by bolts (13) in a manner to provide a planar reflecting surface positioned parallel with the pool wall (20) at a height greater than the uppermost portion of the pool wall. The panel permits quick and easy conversion between wave action pools and non-wave action pools by avoiding the necessity of lowering the water level in a conventional pool when a wave-generating device is employed.
column15: ELLIS HERBERT S;;DELP THOMAS W;;DUNN JAMES F;;ELLIS KENNETH L

column12: Guard apparatus
column13: A guard apparatus for production machines having hazardous work areas in which injury to the machine operator can occur, in which a guard rod is disposed around the perimeter of the hazardous work area and is attached on one end to an emergency circuit activation mechanism connected by an electric circuit to the emergency stop circuitry of the machine. If the guard rod is deflected either upwardly or downwardly, a switch in the activation mechanism is tripped, causing the emergency circuitry of the machine to go into an emergency off condition, thereby stopping the machine. A second emergency circuit activation mechanism can be connected to the other end of the guard rod to provide a back-up for the operation of the guard apparatus if the first switch fails.

column12: An Improved Seed Sower.

Moving-chamber apparatus; for granular material.-In apparatus for sowing seeds of various sizes, the seeds are taken from a hopper and delivered to a coulter by a rotating vertical wheel having adjustable peripheral pockets made up of transverse stops or ridges and hinged plates. The wheel d is mounted in a flat casing a between the hopper b and the delivery spout c. The plates k are hinged at one end to the tops of the stops or ridges e and are provided with arms j carrying studs i engaging in radial slots in a disk or disks f. The size of the pockets is adjusted by swing- ing the plates k about their hinges by turning the disk f. The seeds are kept in the pockets between the hopper b and spout c by a plate spring o. The plates k are provided with recesses k<2>, Fig. 2, for small seeds.

column12: PILL DISPENSER.
column13: A pill dispenser mechanism is provided in which a multilayered compartment is releasably attachable to a receptacle for pills in such a way that pills may be selectively advanced into one compartment, then by selective advancement of one of the compartment layers transfer the pill from the first compartment into a discharge compartment to permit sequential recovery of pills therefrom. In order to accommodate different sized pills, the compartments may be provided with different sized openings to conform to the substantial size and configuration of the pill. Electrical contact switches may be associated with the compartments to sense for the purpose of recording the movement of a pill between one or more, or a combination of both, compartments.

column12: MACHINE SAFETY GUARD
column13: A machine safety guard for stopping a machine during any phase of operation to prevent injury to workers in which a guard lever is disposed between the worker and the hazardous area of the machine and is connected on one end to a pivot shaft. An activating arm extends from the shaft and has a post for operating a microswitch which is connected to the emergency circuit of the machine. When the guard lever is touched the lever pivots on the shaft, thereby lowering the post from the microswitch, causing the emergency circuit to stop the machine. A counterweight is used to control the sensitivity of the guard lever.

column12: Dispensing having a compartment for detecting and counting the dispensed objects especially adapted for dispensing medication and method of using the same
column13: A medication dispenser that includes a receptacle having a counting compartment with a first opening into the receptacle and a second opening through which the pills are dispensed. To be dispensed, the pills must passthrough the counting compartment and are counted during such passage. Both openings are blocked or unblocked by logic built into or remotely connected to the dispenser, which logic determines whether the pills in the compartment should be dispensed. In one embodiment of the dispenser, the pills are counted by sensing the amount of light that is passed through the compartment. The logic counts the pills by subtracting the amount of light transmitted through the compartment when it contains pills from the amount of light transmitted through an empty compartment and comparing the result to the known size of the pills. In an alternative embodiment, the pills are weighed in the counted compartment and the weight is compared to the known weight of a single pill. In a second alternative embodiment, radiation emitted by the pills is counted with a radiation detector.

column12: Turbine static structure for reduced leakage air
column13: A turbine static structure having reduced leakage air is disclosed. A static structure turbine support ring having few segments is disclosed in which the segments have improved thermal expansion capability with reduced air leakage. A plurality of radially extending slots are placed in the segments to reduce stiffness. In order to minimize air leakage through the support ring, generally circumferential slots are placed in the ring and connect with the generally radially extending slots. Positioned in each of the generally radially extending slots and generally circumferential slots, and in contact with each other, are two sheet metal plates. The plates are staked to the support ring structure so as to provide a seal member, yet compensate for thermal growth.

column12: POWER CONTROLLER FOR SUPPLYING A LOAD
column13: The present invention relates to electric power control for supplying a load from two power sources, and in particular though not exclusively, wherein the power supplies are solar panels and an electrical supply grid. The present invention provides a power controller (300) for supplying a load (120) from first and second power supplies, the power controller comprising first storage means (315) arranged to store power from the first power supply (205), switching means (325, 335) arranged to switch between a second storage means (330) and the first storage means or the second power supply depending on a parameter of the first and second storage means, and power supply means arranged to supply power to the load from the second storage means.

column12: Medication dispenser and method of dispensing medication
column13: A medication dispenser includes a container having a main compartment, a selection compartment, and an exit compartment whereby a pill or the like is dispensed from the container by passage from the main compartment, through the selection compartment, and to the exit compartment. The configuration of the pill selection compartment may be selectively varied and adjusted into a preselected configuration substantially conforming to the shape and size of a pill contained in the main compartment. A flexible first gate selectively extends between the selection compartment and the main compartment, a second gate selectively extends between the selection compartment and the exit compartment, and a third gate selectively extends across the exit compartment, near the container exterior. Initially, the second gate is in an extended position, and the first and third gates are in nonextended positions. A single pill is then maneuvered from the main compartment to the selection compartment and positioned adjacent to the second gate. Thereafter, the second gate is moved to a nonextended position, and substantially simultaneously the first and third gates are each moved to an extended position whereby the pill can pass from the selection compartment to the exit compartment and whereby the pills in the main compartment cannot move into the pill selection compartment. The pill interrupts a light beam located in the exit compartment as it passes from the selection compartment to the exit compartment such that the interruption of the light beam indicates the dispensing of the pill.

column12: THERMOPLASTIC POLYOLEFIN COMPOSITIONS HAVING IMPROVED MELT VISCOSITY AND METHODS OF MAKING THE SAME
Wellhead brine treatment
column13: This invention relates to methods, systems and apparatus for producing primary treated brine, i.e. <20 ppm calcium, magnesium, strontium and barium ions at the wellhead of underground salt caverns formed by depletion of their salt content by previous solution mining operations. The purified brine produced is maintained in an anerobic state and transported to chlor-alkali plant installations for use in electrolysis cells for the production of chlorine, sodium hydroxide and hydrogen. Raw brine produced at an operating brine wellhead is injected into a depleted salt cavern along with the treatment chemicals required to purify the raw brine. A novel installation including a producing well or wells, a depleted well cavern or caverns, and support facilities for producing primary treated brine is provided. Also, special wellhead injection tubing, a mixer and radial distributor for injecting the fluids into the cavern are employed which allows for the chemical reaction, precipitation, settling and clarification operations to take place in a pre-selected reaction zone in the cavern. The cavern acts as the reactor for precipitation, settler and clarifier and deposition site for storage of the precipitates which are innocuous solid by-products of the purification process. The methods, systems, installations and apparatus of this invention provide environmental, investment cost and operating advantages, as compared to surface brine treating facilities and operations at the chlor alkali plant installation, or, as compared to other subterranean attempts to purify brine.

column12: Latch
column13: A latch comprising a first member such as a rod 610 configured to move linearly and reciprocally along a first path to drive rotation of a second member such as a disc 622a, which then drives the linear movement of a third member such as an engagement pin 624 along a second path which is non-parallel to the first path. The rod and the engagement pin may be constrained to only move along their respective paths. The disc may contain an arcuate slot 623a, wherein the engagement pin is coupled to the disc via a guide pin slidably engaging with the slot. The latch may be used in a bariatric trolley for adjusting a knee-lift mechanism and may comprise a telescopic arm in which the latch is mounted. The latch may be used to position and lock a moveable platform of the trolley in a plurality of configurations.

column12: Dispenser adapted to isolate the dispensed objects by compression between two movable structures
column13: A medication dispenser for dispensing pills, tablets, capsules, or the like, one at a time from a receptacle in which the medication is arranged loosely to allow for easy filling. In one embodiment, the medication units are passed through a restricted funnel opening, one at a time, and then captured between two cooperating, movable, compressible structures such as wheels, belts, or the like, which move the units to a detector that counts the units as they are removed from the dispenser. In another embodiment, the medication is first captured and then moved through a restricted opening. The dispenser may also include a computer for controlling and/or recording the time of dispensing and the quantity of medication dispensed. Additionally, the dispenser may include two sequentially placed sets of cooperating, movable, structures at different horizontal levels for achieving greater separation of medication units.

column12: A Spring or Non-Pneumatic Tyre for the Wheels of Cycles, Motors and other Vehicles.
column13: 17,463. Ellis, W. T. G., and Jebb, T. A. Aug. 31. Tyres, elastic other than pneumatic; felloes or rims.-Relates to an arched spring-wire tyre, and is shown in section and plan respectively in Figs. 1 and 2, the cover being removed in the plan. The arches are formed by bending a tempered steel wire a, and are held about half an inch apart by the intermediate lengths a', which are adapted to take under the inturned edges b of the wheel rim B. In each arch there are preferably three circular twists a<2> and two opposed inwardly-projecting bends a<3>. A rubber and canvas cover C fits over the arches, and is provided with thickened parts c, which lie in the bends a<3>. Along the tread part of the cover a steel, whalebone, or like band c<2> may be placed, and a wire D may be passed through each series of the circular twists a<2>. In modifications, the twists may be dispensed with, and the wires D and cover may be adapted to hold the arches in their proper relative positions.

column12: New or Improved Apparatus for Distributing Electric Currents and Producing Electric Pulsations.
column13: 2742. Thomson, A. T. M., and Ellis, G. O. Feb. 10. Signals, electric; indicators or annunciators.- Currents transmitted in a number of successive impulses, as in signalling, are caused to pass through several different lines one or more at a time, by means of a multiple-contact switch. with a rotatable arm actuated by a spring or weight released, coincidently with each impulse of current, by an elect o-magnetic escapement. In addition, one or more of the lines contain automaticallyactuated interrupters by which each impulse is broken up into several. Fig. I shows diagrammatically one arrangement of the system. Each current impulse sent from a battery 15 by means of a key or other transmitting-device effects a to-and-fro movement of an electro-magnetic escapement 1, releasing an arbor 33 of a spring-driven train of wheels, not shown, to which a rotatable brush arm 12 of a multiple-contact switch 2 is so connected as to make one-sixth of a revolution at each release. One of the brushes 14 thus moves from one of the segments 7 to the next, and the following current impulse will pass through the next in order of the lines 16; 22, &c. Interrupters 20, 24, &c., consisting of conducting-barrels with projecting teeth adapted to meet spring contacts connected to the lines 16, 22, &c., are geared to the driving-mechanism to make one complete revolution for each release of the escapement 1. Double or multiple brush arms may be used, distributing each current impulse between several different lines. Fig. III. shows the invention applied in telephony to showing indicator numerals by means of revolving drums 40, 41, 42, each of which is actuated by an electro-magnetic escapement in the corresponding line from the multiple - contact switch. The brush arm 12 is actuated as before by an electro-magnetic escapement 1 and key. Another escapement 51, provided with its own key, in a branch line from the battery actuates an interrupter 52 in the common return of the lines 54, 55, &c., by means of which any chosen number of impulses can be sent through whichever of the escapements 43, 44, 45 is in circuit, and the respective drums set to selected numbers. The last contact segment 10 takes the current to lamps 48 which illuminate the numbers. Other indicating or advertising devices may be similarly actuated. Reference is also made to Specification No. 11,708, A.D. 1895, [Abridgment Class Electric telegraphs &c.].

column12: Turbine Static Structure for Reduced Leakage Air
column13: A turbine static structure having reduced leakage air is disclosed. A static structure turbine support ring having few segments is disclosed in which the segments have improved thermal expansion capability with reduced air leakage. A plurality of radially extending slots are placed in the segments to reduce stiffness. In order to minimize air leakage through the support ring, generally circumferential slots are placed in the ring and connect with the generally radially extending slots. Positioned in each of the generally radially extending slots and generally circumferential slots, and in contact with each other, are two sheet metal plates. The plates are staked to the support ring structure so as to provide a seal member, yet compensate for thermal growth.

column12: IMPROVEMENTS IN OR RELATING TO ELECTRIC TIME SWITCH MECHANISMS
column13: 1,272,647. Time switches. SANGAMO WESTON Ltd. 15 Sept., 1970 [17 Sept., 1969], No. 45895/69. Heading H1N. A heavy-current time switch comprises a rigid switch arm 10 having one end pivotally mounted and electrically connected to a first external connection terminal 14, an abutment 18 carried by the arm 10 intermediate its ends, spring means 15 at the other end of the arm 10 biasing the abutment 18 towards rotatable timecontrolled cam means 19, a stationary switch contact 22 carried by a second external connection terminal 23, and a co-operating movable contact 21 actuable by the arm 10. As shown, arm 10 is channel-shaped and cut away to be flexible at 11, the spring 15 is a tension spring, abutment 18 is adjustable by screw 17, and contact 21, carried on a blade spring 20, has a stem 24 passing through arm 10 with an enlarged head 25 such that arm 10 can pull contact 21 away from contact 22, but when the contacts are closed vibration of arm 10 is not transmitted to the contact 21. In a second embodiment (Figs. 2 and 3, not shown) the spring is a compression spring (34) and the moving contact is carried directly on arm 10 and is enclosed in a cup-shaped shroud (35). The arm 10 may be pivotally connected to terminal 14 by a hinged joint and a flexible copper braid.

column12: Method of dispensing medicine
column13: A method of dispensing medicine by providing a medicine package having a sealed reservoir containing the medicine and bearing a machine readable code indicating the contents of the package, initiating the opening of the package with a machine having a special cutting tool, having a code reader for recording the information indicated by the code, and having a clock for recording the time when the opening of the package is initiated. The method of dispensing medicine further includes recording the identity of the person administering the medication and the identify of the person receiving the medication. The method also further includes the step of rendering the machine readable code unreadable upon the initiation of the opening of the package.

column12: PILLENABGABEVORRICHTUNG.
column13: A pill dispenser mechanism is provided in which a multilayered compartment is releasably attachable to a receptacle for pills in such a way that pills may be selectively advanced into one compartment, then by selective advancement of one of the compartment layers transfer the pill from the first compartment into a discharge compartment to permit sequential recovery of pills therefrom. In order to accommodate different sized pills, the compartments may be provided with different sized openings to conform to the substantial size and configuration of the pill. Electrical contact switches may be associated with the compartments to sense for the purpose of recording the movement of a pill between one or more, or a combination of both, compartments.

column12: SYSTEMS, METHODS, AND INTERFACES FOR ANALYZING WEBPAGE PORTIONS
column13: A method includes aggregating a set of analyzed webpage portions from at least two unaffiliated websites. The method also includes transmitting an aggregated result, the aggregated result associated with an aggregated set of analyzed webpage portions. Another embodiment includes the set of analyzed webpage portions being associated with a topic. Yet another embodiment includes receiving an indication of an occurrence of a browser event and analyzing, in response to receiving the indication, a webpage portion then storing an analyzed webpage portion and the browser event in a database. column12: Dispenser adapted to isolate the dispensed objects by compression between two moveable structures
column13: A medication dispenser for dispensing pills, tablets, capsules, or the like, one at a time from a receptacle in which the medication is arranged loosely to allow for easy filling. In one embodiment, the medication units are passed through a restricted funnel opening, one at a time, and then captured between two cooperating, movable, compressible structures such as wheels, belts, or the like, which move the units to a detector that counts the units as they are removed from the dispenser. In another embodiment, the medication is first captured and then moved through a restricted opening. The dispenser may also include a computer for controlling and/or recording the time of dispensing and the quantity of medication dispensed. Additionally, the dispenser may include two sequentially placed sets of cooperating, movable, structures at different horizontal levels for achieving greater separation of medication units.

column12: INTELLIGENT GARBAGE MOVING SYSTEM AND GARBAGE CAN DRIVING METHOD THEREFOR
column13: Disclosed is an intelligent garbage moving system (100), comprising a power moving device (2) for driving a garbage can (1). The power moving device (2) comprises: a housing (20); a connecting portion (21) arranged on the housing (20) and used for selectively connecting to the garbage can (1); a moving module (22) arranged below the housing (20) and used for driving the power moving device (2) to move; a power module (24) for powering the power moving device (2); and a control module (26) for controlling the moving module (22) to drive the power moving device (2) to autonomously move such that the power moving device (2) autonomously drives the garbage can (1) to move from a garbage storage station (330) to a garbage collection station (331) and/or move from the garbage collection station (331) to the garbage storage station (330).

column12: ROBOT AND CONTROL SYSTEM THEREOF
column13: A control system for use in controlling a working state of a robot, comprising the robot (1) and a control unit (10). The control unit (10) comprises an input module (12) for receiving input information of a user and a transmission module (20) for transmitting the input information of the user to the robot (1). The robot (1) comprises a communication unit (7) for communicating with the transmission module (20) and for receiving the input information transmitted by the transmission unit (20), a storage unit (5) for storing a preset program, and a central processing unit (3) electrically connected to the communication unit (7) and to the storage unit (5) and for controlling the working state of the robot (1) on the basis of the input information received by the communication unit (7) and of the preset program. The control unit (10) and the robot (1) are separated from each other. Also disclosed is the robot capable of communicating with the control unit separated therefrom. The control system and the robot allow the user to complete the input of control information to the robot via only the control unit, and provide the user with an operating mode of improved comfort.

column12: GUARD APPARATUS
column13: A guard apparatus for production machines having hazardous work areas in which injury to the machine operator can occur, in which a guard rod is disposed around the perimeter of the hazardous work area and is attached on one end to an emergency circuit activation mechanism connected by an electric circuit to the emergency stop circuitry of the machine. If the guard rod is deflected either upwardly or downwardly, a switch in the activation mechanism is tripped, causing the emergency circuitry of the machine to go into an emergency off condition, thereby stopping the machine. A second emergency circuit activation mechanism can be connected to the other end of the guard rod to provide a back-up for the operation of the guard apparatus if the first switch fails.

column12: Adhesive compositions for hard tissues
column13: An adhesive composition is provided which is suitable for the bonding of polymeric materials, in whole or in part, such as composite resins, or methacrylate-containing glass-ionomer filling materials, to tooth enamel, or tooth dentin, or to other hand tissues of the human body, such as bone. The composition comprises an unsaturated carboxylic acid ester, an unsaturated phosphate ester and other crosslinking agents. The especially preferred phosphates (which are provided as new compounds) are those of formula (I) in which: R _{ 1 } is a hydrogen atom, alkyl C _{ 1 } -C _{ 4 } , or CN; R is an aliphatic, cycloaliphatic or aryl radical containing from 1 to 10 carbon atoms and having a valence of n1; n is an integer from 1 to 5, preferably from 3 to 5.

column12: FOOTWEAR INCLUDING TEXTILE ELEMENT
FOOTWEAR INCLUDING TEXTILE ELEMENT
Plating of articles
column13: A method for plating articles, such as coinage, is described. The method comprising: providing a plating solution comprising a liquid medium, a precursor species suitable for forming a metallic layer on the articles, and a plurality of luminescent particles suspended in the liquid medium, at least some of which have a diameter of 10 μm or less. The luminescent particles have a D50 distribution, measured using laser light scattering, in accordance with ASTM UOP856-07, of 10 μm or less; and plating the articles within the plating solution. The precursor species forms the metallic layer on the articles and the luminescent particles are deposited within the metallic layer while it is formed. The articles, before being plated, comprise one or more first metal(s) selected from silver, gold and platinum, wherein the first metal is in alloy or elemental form, and the metallic layer comprises a second metal, which is a transition metal, wherein the second metal is in alloy or elemental form. A barrel plating system may be used to ensure constant movement of the articles within the plating solution.

column12: Plating of articles
column13: A method and apparatus 100 for plating articles comprises providing a plating solution comprising a liquid medium and plating the articles such that the precursor species forms a metallic layer. A plurality of luminescent particles are suspended in the liquid medium, at least some of which have a diameter of 10 um or less, wherein the luminescent particles have a D50 distribution. The distribution is measured using laser light scattering, in accordance with ASTM U0P856-07, of 10 µm or less. The articles are located within the plating solution, such that the precursor species forms the metallic layer on the articles and the luminescent particles are deposited within the metallic layer while it is formed. The plating is carried out while the articles are within a receptacle that moves during the plating process receptacle and the receptacle rotates at a speed of 1 to 15 rpm. Further disclosed is a method for plating articles, wherein before or during plating the plating solution is subjected to an ultrasound (ultrasonic) treatment and plating is carried out while the articles are within a receptacle that moves continuously 102.
column15: DAVID MATTHEW JAMES;;ELLIS RHYS THOMAS;;GWILYM HIBBERT

column12: SLUSH-MOLDABLE THERMOPLASTIC POLYOLEFIN COMPOSITION FOR INTERIOR UPHOLSTERY
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a thermoplastic polyolefin composition which contains a blend of polypropylene, a styrenic elastomer, a linear low-density polyethylene and a hydrocarbon process oil, and is suitable for slush molding.

SOLUTION: Components which can be optionally used include an ethylene copolymer elastomer, a polymer additive such as a polymer surface modifier and the like, a powder flow additive, a stabilizer and/or coloring pigment. This composition provides a low melt viscosity while it is processed and an improved surface quality for molded items. A typical composition comprises about 20-50 wt.% of polypropylene or its copolymer, about 20-60 wt.% of a styrenic elastomer, about 5-50 wt.% of linear low-density polyethylene, and about 2-25 wt.% of a hydrocarbon process oil. The zero shear viscosity of the composition suitable for slush molding is in the range of about 300-900 Pa s over the processing temperature of 180-260 °C.

column13: There is provided a process for preparing a prepreg (31) comprising reinforcement fibre (13) impregnated with a thermosetting resin matrix (20), said process comprising: a) providing a layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13); b) applying a layer (24) of a first thermosetting resin matrix (20) to the first surface (15) of the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) and bringing the first surface (15)of the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) into contact with the support surface (5) of a first continuous belt (3), so that the layer (24) of first thermosetting resin matrix (20) is positioned between, and in contact with, the first surface (15) of the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) and the support surface (5) of the first continuous belt (3); c) heating the layer (24) of first thermosetting resin matrix (20) applied to the first surface (15) of the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) in contact with the support surface (5) of the first continuous belt (3); d) bringing the second surface (17) of the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) into contact with the support surface 9) of a second continuous belt (7); e) heating the layer (24) of first thermosetting resin matrix (20) and the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) between the support surfaces of the first and second continuous belts (3, 7) so that the first thermosetting resin matrix (20) impregnates the layer(24) of reinforcement fibre (13); f) cooling the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) impregnated with the first thermosetting resin matrix (20) between the support surfaces of the first and secondcontinuous belts (3, 7); and g) removing the layer (24) of reinforcement fibre (13) impregnated with the first thermosetting resin matrix (20) from the support surfaces of the first and second continuous belts (3, 7).

column12: FOOTWEAR UPPER INCLUDING VARIABLE STITCH DENSITY
column13: An article of footwear includes a sole and an upper at least partially formed of a textile element. The textile element includes a yarn matrix having a plurality of interlocked strands oriented in predetermined directions. A structural element may be captured within the matrix at selected locations. In operation, the matrix is stitched onto a temporary substrate. The substrate is removed and the article coupled to a sole structure to form the article of footwear.

column12: FERNSEHSCHWATZSYSTEM
Adhesive compositions for hard tissues
column13: An adhesive composition is provided which is suitable for the bonding of polymeric materials, in whole or in part, such as composite resins, or methacrylate-containing glass-ionomer filling materials, to tooth enamel, or tooth dentin, or to other hand tissues of the human body, such as bone. The composition comprises an unsaturated carboxylic acid ester, an unsaturated phosphate ester and other crosslinking agents. The especially preferred phosphates (which are provided as new compounds) are those of formula (I) in which: R _{ 1 } is a hydrogen atom, alkyl C _{ 1 } -C _{ 4 } , or CN; R is an aliphatic, cycloaliphatic or aryl radical containing from 1 to 10 carbon atoms and having a valence of n1; n is an integer from 1 to 5, preferably from 3 to 5.

column12: Bone plates
column13: A bone plate 20 for fixing a bone 22 comprises at least two clip portions 24, 26, each clip portion 24, 26 having a pair of arms 34,36 so that each clip portion 24, 26 receives the bone 22 between the pair of arms 34,36, a spanning portion 40 connected to only one of the arms 34, 36 of each clip portion 20, 26 and configured to extend along the bone 22 between the at least two clip portions 24, 26 to span a discontinuity 42 in the bone 22. The bone plate 20 may be used on rib bones. The bone plate may comprise two components, each having a clip portion, being connected via a spanning portion. The bone plates may also comprise a bridge region 38 joining the two arms 34,36, the bridge region may be narrower than the arm region to facilitate bending. Also claimed is a kit for fixing a bone comprising at least one of the afore described bone plates and at least one of a fastener, an instrument for measuring one or more dimensions of the bone, and an instrument for bending at least a portion of at least one bone plate inter-operatively.

column12: Slush moldable thermoplastic polyolefin formulation for interior skin
column13: A thermoplastic polyolefin composition suitable for slush molding comprising a blend of polypropylene, styrenic elastomer, linear low density polyethylene and a hydrocarbon-based process oil. Optional components include an ethylene copolymer elastomer, polymer additives such as polymer surface modifiers, powder flow additives, stabilizers and/or color pigments. The compositions exhibit a low melt viscosity during processing and improved surface quality for the molded article. An exemplary composition includes about 20-50 wt. % polypropylene or copolymer thereof, about 20-60 wt. % of a styrenic elastomer, about 5-50 wt. % linear low density polyethylene, and about 2-25 wt. % of a hydrocarbon-based process oil. The zero shear viscosity of the composition suitable for slush molding is in the range of about 300-900 Pa·s over a processing temperature range of 180-260° C.
